content: If you have a product scanning incoming mail try disabling that feature or product. History shows most of these sorts of issues are caused by failed antivirus products.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Are you using IMAP? What is the retention period of junk with your chosen mail provider. Most of mine the provider deletes junk/spam after 14 days. But there is some variability provider to provider.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Yes, I'm using IMAP. I have 2 other devices sync'd to my PC. I only manage messages on the PC, never on the mobile devices. The retention time has never been an issue in the past. I would always manually delete messages in the junk folder, usually every 45 to 60 days.

content:
Quello che posso confermare è che molti utenti hanno segnalato di non riuscire più ad usare Thunderbird con la PEC di Poste.

Non c'è al momento alcuna iniziativa per supportarla in futuro. Sia perché la stragrande maggioranza degli sviluppatori di Thunderbird non è italiana, sia perché le risorse sono limitate.

content: How are you doing the exports? One possibility would be to 1) create the folder first with desired name, and then 2) use the importexporttools NG addon, then 3) rightclick on the message folder in Thunderbird, select the importexport menu option to export mbox.

content: The devil is in the details. I suggest you click to accountsettings, scroll down left side to 'local folders, and click the browse button at bottom of right pane to select the location of the local folders, as you indicated they are on a different drive. That may cause Thunderbird to reboot.
creator: davidsk

content: Are you viewing in Local Folders or the account folders? If in Local Folders, you may have moved just the headers.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for the question, but no, I'm viewing it in "account folders." That's why I can see the texts on the server. I also have an Inbox in local folders, and none of them are on the server, and I looked at a few emails ans all the texs are there.

I am baffled by this. The only thing I can think of is to reinstall Thunderbird, but I have no way of knowing if that will work, so I am asking here first.
creator: f30

content: Please clarify: from your post, I infer that when you view in account folders in thunderbird that the text is there, but if you view in the Local Folders folders that the text is not there. True? If so, that implies that when you copied to local folders the account folders only had headers. IMAP doesn't populate content unless you click to read the messages. In that case, there is no need to reinstall. Once IMAP messages are copied out of the account folders, thunderbird no longer populates content there.
creator: davidsk

content: If not using 128.1.1, updating may help if what you're experiencing part of what may have been a bug. Also, try a folder repair afterwards and see if that helps.
creator: davidsk
